headline: Easy Bulgogi (Korean BBQ Beef)
description: Bulgogi, or Korean barbecued beef, is made with thin slices of tender marinated beef in a sweet-savory sauce. Easy to prep and very easy to eat!

video.description: The flavorful and easy Korean classic!
video.name: Easy Bulgogi (Korean BBQ Beef)

name: Easy Bulgogi (Korean BBQ Beef)
recipeIngredient: 2 green onions, chopped, dark green parts separated from white and light green parts
1.5 pounds beef sirloin steak, cut very thin using kitchen shears

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk soy sauce, white and light green parts of green onions, yellow onion, sugar, garlic, sesame seeds, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, ginger, and black pepper together in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Add steak slices and toss to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour, or up to 1 day.

Heat a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, cook and stir steak and marinade together in the hot skillet, adding honey to caramelize the steak, until steak is cooked through, about 5 minutes. Garnish bulgogi with dark green parts of green onions.

review.reviewBody: The marinade smelled amazing and I was very excited for this recipe but it just didn't end up being flavorful enough despite marinating thin strips of sirloin for at least 24h.
Easy and delicious, we serve it over long grain white rice.

My daughter helped me prepare this as part of an international meal. Everybody liked it & only about 1 serving left; One lady took a portion home so yeah, I think it was liked by all! I’ll probably be adventuresome & make it again!
Great taste and easy to prepare

I'm not sure what authentic Korean BBQ is supposed to taste like but we liked this recipe for something different. I followed the recipe exactly using a Chuck steak that I sliced thin. Served it with fried rice and sautéed broccoli.

I made this exactly according to the recipe using flank steak. I have only eaten Bulgogi a few times, but this is the tastiest I have tried, and it is so easy to prepare. I like it better than the highest rated Korean restaurant in my city. I will be making this often.
Love the recipe. Just want to mention to watch the honey at the end if you cook it in batches may come out a bit sweet. All in all the family loved it and wanted more.
This was delicious; comparable to a restaurant I used to order it from. The only thing I did differently was omit the sesame seeds.
Great recipe! I mixed the honey in before refrigerating. This was mouth watering good!
Very quick and easy but flavorful recipe. I will make this again. Due to time constraints, I only marinated the beef strips for about an hour. I will definitely marinate them longer next time.
I could not get the marinade to cook down fast enough to keep up with the beef. I would not pour all of the marinade in the next time.
This was really good and easy to make. Next time I will make a little more sauce, though, because the leftovers were a tad dry.
Delicious just like it is!
great

I have always used pork. Slice while semi frozen. I marinate for 3 days. I drain the meat, roll it in honey. Then sugar. Sprinkle sesame seeds on it and broil till caramelized. Sprinkle with green onion pieces, sliced into tiny rings. I call it Sticky Sweet Sesame Sticks. Enjoy!!!

I didn't have ginger, so I omitted it. I also used regular crushed red pepper flakes. I marinated for about 4 hours.

The rice and eggroll are both store bought.

Very tasty!
This is so flavorful and very easy to make when you’re short on time! I highly recommend this recipe and will make again.
After reading the other reviews, I decided to cut down on the soy sauce and make up the quantity with water. The saltiness was just right and it was delicious.
I love this recipe and did modify but for the easy recipe it is good!

Loved it! Doubled the soy sauce and sesame oil, quadrupled the chili flakes because we like it spicy and saucy. Let the meat sit in the marinade for a full day and served with Jasmine rice. Fantastic!
Easy to make and tastes amazing!!!
Yum! I added too much soy sauce (amino acids). Was tasty for sure though
I love this and make it all the time. I add a little Japanese wine to the marinade

The meat to marinade ratio seemed off (too little marinade).

The honey for caramelization is a great trick, will use in the future for other applications.

Flank steak is a very expensive way to make this recipe at Virginia prices. I miss Texas prices on flank.

May try more marinade and more economical cut of meat next time.
Delicious. Used flank steak and it was so tender.
Turned out excellent. I let it marinate for 9 hours. Steak is tender and there is a lot of depth to the flavor.

I did make a couple of substitutions but I don't think they drastically changed the taste of this dish. I substituted Stevia for the sugar and Bragg's Liquid Aminos for soy sauce to improve the health of this dish. I also substituted crushed red pepper for the Korean pepper flakes because I didn't have those on hand. Super easy recipe and turns out amazing. Make sure to use fresh ginger and garlic. Using fresh is always way better than using powdered. My husband loved this dish and even my picky teen son gobbled it up.

I have made this many times just as written. I is so good that everyone who has eaten it, raves about the yummy taste.
I wish I knew how to add a photo.
Followed recipe exception for sesame oil. Kids love it. Absolutely will make again.
it was great

This was amazing. I used Ribeye Shaved steak because it was on sale. I doubled the recipe. I used less red paper flakes, no honey, and added mushrooms. Everyone went for seconds. My daughter said it was better than the restaurant's!

This was absolutely delicious and I highly recommend this recipe! I’ve tried a bunch of others but none were as good as this one. This is a definite keeper! I plan to make this frequently as my kids always request bulgogi:) yuuum! I followed the recipe exactly as written

An excellent recipe! Made exactly as presented in this recipe and taste was outstanding. I will follow the advice of others here for next time and freeze steak for a short while prior to cutting. I did cut a little thick. I'm sure if cut thinner, it will be outstanding. Family loved it!

This is our go-to recipe for bulgogi. The only changes we like to make are to use low-sodium sauce and far more gochugaru than the recipe calls for. I usually serve the bulgogi on a bed of rice. I like to cook thinly-sliced zucchini and ribboned carrots with oil and salt and pepper in a separate pan, then combine the vegetables with the meat when they're both done cooking.
This was soooo good!!! The real deal.

Try low sodium soy sauce next time.
I liked cutting up a green bell pepper and adding it to the bowl a couple minutes before stir frying. And they still had some crunch to it which we liked. I’d like to try a tad bit more sugar and I was happy adding chives instead of green onions.

This is a real easy bulgogi recipe and very tasty. I lived in Korea for two years and bulgogi became one of mine and my families favorite recipes. I have a more involved one but this recipe is by far very good for an easy version. I have used top of the round that I find already sliced thin in the grocery store and use a pair of shears to slice it. The marinade tenderizes it nicely. I like to take the meat and cut it up and guests can take a lettuce leaf, some rice and meat and a sliver of garlic and pop it in your mouth. It is delicious and the traditional way to serve it. I would recommend this recipe.

Don't dump in the peppercorn flakes like I did. Too hot for end of Summer consumption, unless your sinuses are clogged. Otherwise, this is an excellent quick meal addition with just some additional vegetables like carrots, the rest of the onion, and quinoa.
I didn't make any changes and will definitely make it again!

I didn't have any sesame seeds so I left that out. I just made the sauce and sliced some portabella mushrooms to marinate overnight in the sauce. Then I used the dehydrator at 110 degrees for 4 hours. AMAZING!
Delicious!
Love this recipe. Quick, tasty, and soooooo good. I made this several times, great left over and re-heated.
Loved it! Excellent and most authentic...and I have tried many Bulgogi recipes.
I made no changes to the recipe at all and it was absolutely delicious! It is definitely a keeper.
Exceptional! Followed instructions except left out yellow onion. Came out superb! and with great feedback. So easy too!
good
I use venison with this and it is absolutely a family favorite. We increase the fresh ginger by a lot, but we love ginger. Very forgiving recipe no matter what you do.
Next time I will double the marinade so I have some sauce for rice. I think I will omit the sugar and double the red pepper flakes. Otherwise pretty good. I used flat iron steak which was great.
Tasty and easy! I added two chopped Jalapenos for some heat.

This is one of the best recipes I have ever made!!!! So many layers of flavor. We happened to marinate it for longer than one hour and that seemed to work out well. Will definitely make this recipe again and again!

After having this at a Korean BBQ place, I had to try it.
I fudged a few ingredients (sliced ginger, leeks for onions, added sake). I used tri tip thinly sliced. Served with red leaf lettuce, fresh cilantro, and rice. Om nom nom all around. Will make again.
Not quite the depth of flavor I get at our usual restaurant, wondering if there should be something like a touch of miso in it, or maybe it's just the beef I used
I made this recipe and it was great. I mixed with casamiento. They went very nicely.
With the addition of 2 tablespoons of brown sugar and some slivers of Serrano peppers it was great!

We really liked this dish! I added extra ginger because my family loves it. I let it marinate for about 6 hours and then popped it on skewers and grilled them. Served with jasmine rice and sesame broccoli. Next time I’ll double the marinade and cook up the sauce to serve alongside it.

I have made this dish three of four times now and am addicted to it. I add a little extra sugar or honey to the recipe and it fits my palate better. I love it with sticky rice rolled in red lettuce leaf as suggested. Great easy main dish. Thanks.
this dish is tasty and easy to make in the future i will use my slow cooker and double the ingredients does not make that much
Delicious!!!
It's very simple to make and tastes great!
delicious! I just cut up veges that were on hand and stir-fried them and added them to the beef, and some rice vermicelli.
It was well liked all around. I used KC Strip--which had been in the freezer for a year and it tasted great.
I loved this one.
I have used this recipe twice with no changes. We love this it's so easy and so delicious it's a favorite!
My Korean friend said it tasted authentic! I used tamari sauce instead of traditional soy sauce, due to an allergy. We all loved it! I will make it again.
I followed the recipe exactly as written. The recipe is amazingly delicious !!!! Wouldn't change a thing and can't wait to make again.

I love this recipe! Have made it a couple times, using flank steak cut thinly, and I marinate it for a few hours. The first time I did it, I accidentally included the honey in the marinade (rather than adding at the end when cooking) and it still turned out delicious.
Really good and easy! I halved the red pepper flakes, to be safe. But that wasn't necessary. Next time, the recipe will be followed as is.
Very good and easy. Next time I'll add more spice.
Followed the recipe with a bit more honey! And it is now my favorite meal! This was my first time hearing of this and trying it. We had it over rice. And I’ve had it in a Roman lettuce leaf!
Delicious and tender. My husband said it's restaurant quality! I didn't use the honey.

This was as good as a far more complicated and time-consuming Korean BBQ recipe I've made in the past, but sooo much easier to make!

I used whole beef tenderloin (cut into thin slices as directed), I used dried rather than fresh ginger, and we ate it wrapped in organic butterhead lettuce. I bought some Asian sauces for dipping as well. As a note, I did drizzle honey on the beef as I cooked it and it was good! Subtle -- you couldn't even tell it was there. I highly recommend this recipe. Use a good cut of beef!
Didn’t make any changes besides replacing the white sugar with brown sugar it was delicious will continue to make
I made no changes and would make it many more times!
I made this AMAZING Korean Bulgogi BBQ Beef dish last weekend. My husband I and raved about it the entire week. i will be keeping this recipe in my rotation from now on! YUM!
Loved it! Easy to make and very tasty.
east to make use a wok if you have one and use low sodium soy

I thought the recipe looked too sweet so I reduced the sugar a little and added some lemon juice. Also I didn’t finish it with honey as the recipe suggested. I did add a dab of hot spicy sauce and some ground cayenne, but next time I'll use something like Korean red pepper flakes as in the recipe, because the visual appeal of those little red flecks in the sauce is important to stimulate the appetite. 
The meat was a little tough, so next time I'll either tenderize the meat with a mallet or use a more tender cut. 
In spite of the problems, which were my doing, it was delicious, so I give it 5 stars.
I made this dish following the exact ingredients and directions. This is definitely a KEEPER to cook again whenever I have a craving for a Korean beef dish!
Followed recipe except cut the sugar in half. Nice tender beef, it disappears fast.

Great flavors and not too hot for my “not spicy” family. Great with lettuce to wrap as in the pics or with white rice. I reduced the marinade and poured on top of the finished beef and that added to the flavors. Will make again.
Delicious and easy to fix. Will definately make this again.
This was soooo easy to make! I couldn’t find sesame seeds or oil so don’t worry if you can’t either~ this is amazingly delicious!! Super good bulgogi! Try to go easy on the honey : D!!

Tastes great and easy to make! I used arrancheras-style beef (unseasoned) from a local Hispanic market that was cleaned and run through the machine for me so it was already thin and I could just cut it into strips. Delicious!
Amazing and easy!!!

Good, but I expected a deeper flavor. I used CocoAmino instead of traditional soy sauce, so that might have tempered the flavor. Easy to prepare. I think I will use my counter-top grill next time to try for a deeper flavor. Paired with cabbage/bacon stir-fry.
I ended up having the meat marinate over night- and wow.

It was pretty close to what I actually taste in Asian restaurants. However, it is a tad bit tougher and more salty than the ones that I have had there. I would go with the coke or pineapple juice tenderizing agent, but otherwise it was honestly pretty good!

I'd make it again. I didn't make any changes, and marinated it for 6 hours. I did use a cheap cut of beef, instead of sirloin, as I thought he marinade would over power the beef anyway. i will try it with sirloin next time.

I absolutely love this recipe. I changed the meat to flap meat instead of top sirloin and it came out so super tender and I didn’t need to cook it very long. I also marinated it for a day and a half. This is definitely going to be in rotation all the time.

I made the recipe exactly, marinated overnight. I got "bulgogi meat" from my local Korean butcher. My family enjoyed it, however I expected the tastes to be much bolder; it was rather mild though I've never had bulgogi before so perhaps that's how it's supposed to taste. It didn't knock my socks off as awesome, but we all liked it and it was a good starter recipe for a Korean food newbie like me. I will make it again if my husband requests it but probably won't think of it myself.
Love this easy dish! Instead of white sugar I used the same amount of dark brown sugar. I make a little extra of the marinade to drizzle on after serving

My husband and I love this, and it was very easy! I scaled it down for two servings, as there were only the two of us. I only had time to marinate 15 minutes, but that did not detract from the flavor or tenderness. In addition, I did not have honey (one of the few times in my household I did not have it!) so substituted about a teaspoon of brown sugar. Served over basmati rice, with juicy sliced oranges on the side, it was wonderful. I think using FRESH ginger makes a big difference. I absolutely plan to make this again.

Excellent recipe, fairly easy to put together. You know you've made it right when you family says they can't get enough of it. Bulgogi, from my experience, is a very deliciously addictive dish and this recipe is no exception.

It turned out perfect. I only marinated for 2 hours and it was already very flavorful. Used skirt steak instead of sirloin to save on cost; was a little chewier as a result but still tasty. Served it with uncooked lettuce and shredded carrots on corn tortillas for bulgogi beef tacos. So tasty.
GREAT RECIPEI just made the marinade and combined it with ginger, kimchi, and rice. It tastes great, although i would recommend using low-sodium soy sauce or else it is too salty for my taste.
I made recipe..added more garlic and grilled in a grll basket...marinated for one hour and served over rice! Big hit....doubled recipe and no leftovers!

So good! This was my first time making this since my boyfriend loves Korean food but the restaurant stuff can be really unhealthy. Served it with steamed rice, stir fry, cucumber salad, and kimchi. I used London Broil and it came out amazing, so tender and no chunks of fat or gristle to eat around. The trick is to pay attention, turn the meat onto the sauce that's burning so it stops burning and won't be wasted and turn bitter.
Very tasty! I did cool it down a little by not adding the red pepper flakes. It was still delicious and everyone loved it! I'll definitely make this one again,

I used chuck steak, it turned out really good! I would slice the steak thinner next time, but I thought the chuck worked fine. I also didn't add red pepper because of my little ones but it was great! I served with julienne carrots, radishes and cucumbers in a leaf of romaine lettuce! Super good- we ate all of it!
